comments.author: smnaveen@lycos.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1 an internal website in the company has the following html tag; it basically is a navigation menu; if we click on the '+" mark, it makes menu expand and reveal 2 other links. this does not work in firefox. Not sure why   Interface Publications
  • Internal Publications
  • Public Publications
Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.i go to my internal website 2. click on "+" link 3. firefox does not expand the menu Actual Results: nothing happens... Expected Results: the menu is supposed to expand and reveal 2 other submenus

comments.author: elmar.ludwig@uos.de
comments.creator: elmar.ludwig@uos.de
comments.text:
Can you please attach a complete testcase, i.e. a complete web page including style definition and JavaScript if appropriate?

The lines you quoted (on their own) should not expand in IE either.
comments.raw_text:
Can you please attach a complete testcase, i.e. a complete web page including style definition and JavaScript if appropriate?

The lines you quoted (on their own) should not expand in IE either.

comments.author: smnaveen@lycos.com
comments.text:
Elmar,

attached find an HTML testcase.

when u open the page in IE, u will see a MENU on the  lefthand side.
in that u will see an item called "Interface Publications "
to the left of the text "Interface Publications "  there will an unrendered gif,

click on the GIF and u will see the "Interface Publications "  expand giving 2 child menus (internal Publications  *  public publications )

thanks
comments.creator: smnaveen@lycos.com

comments.text:
This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode
comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
